destinations.name: Patenagi
destinations.description: Patenogi lying at the height of 3100 meter from the sea level, is a popular tourist destination, home to high-altitude wildlife and birds. This area is Nepal's first officially designated Red Panda Conservation Forest Zone, making it the best place to visit for Red Panda, sight seeing trekking (from Ranke, from Deurali Dhappar, Sukepokhari, or from Baghkhor), Sunrise and Sunset views, Sunuwar culture, farm houses and home stays, local products and local services of milk products and wines. It is also famous for Sunuwar settlement and their culture, green meadows, medicinal herbs, snowfall, Picnicking, mountain views of Mt. Kunchenjunga and Mt. Kumbhakarna.

details.significance: Nepal's first Red Panda Conservation Forest Zone, High-altitude wildlife and birds, Sunuwar culture and settlement
details.production: Tourism, local products, milk products, and wines
details.impact: Wildlife conservation, Cultural preservation, Sustainable tourism development

destinations.name: Shree Antu
destinations.description: Antu Danda, located at the height of 2,328 meters above the sea level, about 53 kilometres east from Ilam bazar, offers stunning sunrise and sunset views, including the cosmic dance of sunrise particularly from October to December. The area features flatlands of terai terraced farmlands, dense pine forests, and tea gardens of both India and Nepal. Visitors can stay at famous local homes or home stays, enjoy picnicking, hiking experience, view of Kanyam's green world of tea and study of endangered Lepcha community.

details.significance: Stunning sunrise and sunset views, Origin of home stays in Ilam, Views of Indian hill stations (Kurseong, Darjeeling, etc.)
details.workers: Local home stay operators and guides
details.impact: Model village for rural tourism, Preserves Lepcha community culture, Promotes sustainable tourism

destinations.name: Panitar Tea State
destinations.description: Panitar Tea State, located 38 km from Ilam headquarter, offers a beautiful tea garden with small ridges, pine trees, and singing birds. It is a popular destination for picnicking, educational tours, field work, recreation, video shooting, and panoramic views of mountain ranges. It is situated in between Mangalbare and Jeetpur in the west of Ilam with a comparatively young and beautiful tea garden. One can enjoy the beauty of nature and cultures of Tamang, Magar and Rai communities.

details.significance: Young and beautiful tea garden, Cultural diversity (Tamang, Magar, Rai communities), Popular tourist destination
details.workers: Tea garden workers and local guides
details.impact: Major tourist attraction, Supports local economy, Preserves cultural heritage

destinations.name: Sandakpur
destinations.description: Sandakpur, located on the Nepal-India frontier, offers stunning views of the world's highest snow-clad mountains, Kangchenjunga Makalu, Lhotse and Kumbhakarma including Mt. Everest. It is a snow land located at the height of 3636 meter and the area is known for its spectacular sunrise and sunset views next to Sri-Antu and Siddhithumka, bird watching, and endangered species like Red Panda, and Yoks.

details.significance: Highest hill of Ilam district, Origin of the holy Maikhola River, Views of eastern Himalayas and Indian hills
details.impact: Promotes adventure tourism, Supports local economy, Preserves natural beauty and biodiversity

destinations.name: Gajurmukhi Devi Temple
destinations.description: Located on the hillside shaped as a pinnacle and hence, its name is Gajurmukhi, this holy place is situated on the bank of Deumai river in Tobhang village at about 700 metres' height from the sea level. This goddess is also known as a child giving deity to the childless and voice giving deity to the voiceless. It has a naturally carved stone with carved images of gods and goddesses inside the 5 to 7 metres long Cave.

details.significance: Child giving deity to the childless, Voice giving deity to the voiceless, Naturally carved stone with images of gods and goddesses
details.production: Religious and cultural events, Annual fair at Kartik Purnima
details.impact: Promotes religious tourism, Preserves Limbu culture and traditions, Supports local economy through tourism

destinations.name: Didi Bahini Jharana
destinations.description: Didi-Bahini Jharna (Sisters Falls) are two beautiful waterfalls at the right and left side at Puwamajuwa falling together from about the altitude of 2100 meters from the sea-level. It is a short distance of an hour drive from Ilam Bazar, including some minute's off-road hike from near Baghkhor of Mechi Highway. It is the second long waterfall after Todke Jharna of Ilam.

details.significance: Second longest waterfall in Ilam, Twin waterfalls falling together, Rich in biodiversity
details.impact: Promotes adventure tourism, Supports local economy through tourism, Preserves natural beauty and biodiversity

destinations.name: Seti Devi Temple
destinations.description: Seti Devi Temple is a small religious site located at Barabhaiya village, now known as Barabasti, near Ilam Bazar. It lies at a walking distance of half an hour through old tea garden at the west of Ilam bazar. It is believed to have been settled down by 12 Chhetri Subedi brothers some 200 years ago. This peaceful village is still populated by Chhetri Subedi Brothers.

details.attraction: Lower Mai Valley Birds Watching Zone
details.significance: Historical temple established 200 years ago by 12 Chhetri Subedi brothers, Home to 15 species of birds
details.production: Religious and cultural events, Bird watching activities
details.impact: Promotes local tourism, Connects Ilam Municipality-6 and Deumai Municipality-6, Supports local economy through improved road access

destinations.name: Maisthan Temple
destinations.description: Maisthan Temple, located in downtown Ilam Bazar, is renowned for its distinctive three-storey pagoda structure. The temple is central to the annual Devi yatra (Homage to the goddess) festival, celebrated on the full moon day of Chaitra (March-April). The Dashain festival is also a significant event here, marked by animal sacrifices including buffaloes, goats, cocks, and ducks to different deities.

details.significance: Historical temple with three-storey pagoda structure, Known as Ghantaghar or Clock Tower, Contains 'Khalanga Dhunga' stone and 'Nisana' restoration
details.impact: Major religious and cultural center in Ilam, Hosts important festivals like Devi yatra and Dashain

destinations.name: Ilam Tea Factory
destinations.description: Tea cultivation in Nepal began between 1863 AD and 1865 AD by Col. Gaja Rajsingh Thapa, who was inspired by young Darjeeling hill tea plantations. Ilam tea factory, the oldest tea factory and a living legend of Ilam bazar, was established in 1878 B.S by Col. Thapa himself. This historical factory is still in existence as the beauty of Ilam hill town and glory of Nepalese tea industry.

details.significance: Historical tea factory established in 1878 B.S, First tea factory in Nepal
details.production: Various types of tea including orthodox, green, pearl, silver, black
details.impact: Major contributor to Nepal's tea industry and tourism

destinations.name: Sukilumba Airport
destinations.description: Falgunanda airport, also known as Ilam airport, is located in Sukilumba, Ilam Municipality-9. It is an hour-long flight from Kathmandu to Ilam, with a 670-meter and black-topped runway. The airport has a new boundary and terminal construction, benefiting passengers from Panchthar, Terhathum, and Taplejung districts. Test flight was conducted on Jestha 21st, 2075 (2018 AD).

details.significance: Regional airport connecting Ilam with Kathmandu, Serves multiple districts
details.impact: Improves accessibility, Promotes tourism, Economic development

destinations.name: Sukilumba Devithan
destinations.description: Located in Ilam Municipality-9, Golakharkha atop near the airport, this temple is a historical and religious place of Limbu, Tamang and Brahmin/Chetry communities having a natural cave, stone steps, Shiva and Buddha images etc. Sukilumba, the word derived from 'Seselung Hangsam Manghim' meaning 'Steep rock' has about 9 ropanies of land.

details.significance: Historical temple with natural cave and stone steps, Multi-cultural worship site
details.impact: Promotes religious harmony, Preserves cultural heritage

destinations.name: Bhimsenthan
destinations.description: Bhimsenthan Temple is a pagoda styled temple located in the south part of Ilam Chowk Bazar. It is worshiped traditionally as the protector and almighty (Kul Devata) of Newar community. Phulpati Swostip of herbs and armel is celebrated here with high spirit of festivity in Dashain. It was built in 1909 AD by the then Lieutenant Arun Thapa.

details.address: South part of Ilam Chowk Bazar
details.significance: Historical temple built in 1909 AD, Important for Newar community
details.impact: Preserves Newar culture and traditions

destinations.name: Sakela Tham
destinations.description: Sakela Tham, established in 2052 (1995 AD) is a religious site for Rai communities in Ilam Municipality-7, near the old tea garden at Opidhara near Nepal Electricity Office. It features Udauli and Ubhauli festivals during rice harvesting time at Baisakh Purnima. Yalamber Statue, Mangkhi, Kirant Rai Yayokhya etc are established at the spot in 2078 (2021 AD).

details.significance: Important cultural site for Rai community, Features Udauli and Ubhauli festivals
details.impact: Preserves Rai culture and traditions

destinations.name: Siddhithumka
destinations.description: Siddhithumka, located at 1,693 meter above the sea level, is a popular destination for sunrise and sunset views of the Everest and Kanchenjunga mountains and Mahabharata and Churiya ranges. Other popular destinations near the temple include Jhyaupokhari lake, Panchami bazar, Khandrung Cave, Singhadevisthan, Fulbari, Namthala, Pankhelung falls, Ratopani, Falgunanda Manghim Temple, and Mai loop river scene.

details.significance: Views of Everest and Kanchenjunga, Agricultural tourism with rice paddies and orange cultivation
details.impact: Promotes agricultural tourism, Supports local economy

destinations.name: Sanu Pathivara Temple
destinations.description: Lying in the eastern region of Nepal at the height of 1765 meter, the temple of Goddess Pathivara is the most visited holy spot. It is considered to be a sister temple to Taplejung's original Pathivara Devi. Those who can't afford to visit the original temple at 3,794 mtr can visit this one just above Sunmai.

details.significance: Sister temple to Taplejung's Pathivara Devi, Alternative pilgrimage site
details.impact: Promotes religious tourism, Provides accessible pilgrimage option

destinations.name: Mahabhir Rock Climbing
destinations.description: Located in Ilam Municipality-8, at the bottom of Tare Pahara (Steep Cliff) of Mahabhir (Honey Cliff), Rock Climbing spot was constructed in 2070 B.S (2013 AD), with 7 climbing tracks to climb a single rock of 85 feet height. It features 7 climbing tracks, 2016 steps, iron railings, a resting place, and a one-storey RCC room.

details.distance: 30 minutes walk or 10 minutes drive from Tilkeni Mode
details.significance: Rock climbing facility with 7 tracks, Potential bungee jump spot
details.impact: Promotes adventure tourism, Attracts sports enthusiasts

destinations.name: Bouddha Park
destinations.description: Located in Ilam Municipality-8, Mahabhir, Bouddha Park was constructed in 2055 B.S (1993 AD), in 2 Ropanies of land on the route to rock climbing spot. There are 12 electric bulbs installed, erection of Buddha's image inside 65 meters of circular area with tiles on the pavement and 2 steps of walls around.

details.distance: 30 minutes walk or 10 minutes drive from Tilkeni Mode
details.significance: Buddhist cultural site with Buddha statue, Community space with playground
details.impact: Promotes Buddhist culture, Provides community recreation space

destinations.name: Singhbahini Temple
destinations.description: Singhbahini Devi Temple, located in the south corner of Ilam chowk bazar, is a major religious center for weddings, Bratabandha (upanayan) and religious activities like pujas, bhajan kirtan, death rites etc. Singhbahini temple is also known as a monkey temple of Ilam.

details.address: South corner of Ilam chowk bazar
details.significance: Major center for Hindu ceremonies, Known as monkey temple
details.impact: Preserves religious traditions, Supports community ceremonies

destinations.name: Narayanthan Temple
destinations.description: Situated at the north part of Ilam bazar, Narayansthan is recognized as the best place for sightseeing of green and lively Ilam. The Narayansthan was built by Ilame Sahu (local trader) Bhawani Das Rajlawat establishing Vishnu Narayan and Bal Govinda idols in the temple.

details.significance: Historical temple with multiple deities, Natural water sources and fish pond
details.impact: Preserves religious heritage, Provides scenic viewpoint

destinations.name: Ilam View Tower
destinations.description: Ilam View Tower, inaugurated in 2014 AD, is a five-storey building covered with glasses, offering stunning views of Ilam tea garden, campus, Siddhithumka hill, and terai belts. It is located just above Ilam bazaar near tea garden and Panitanki.

details.significance: Modern glass tower offering panoramic views
details.impact: Enhances tourism infrastructure, Provides panoramic views

destinations.name: Bhalu Dhunga
destinations.description: Bhalu Dhunga, a 14-hectare forest area in Ilam Municipality-6, Gadhithumka, is a popular spot for sunrise views and bird watching. Surrounded by a community forest at the end of Ilam tea garden, it is home to 132 bird species from 41 families. A 2021 bird survey found 115 species in the nearby Seti Devi forest.

details.significance: Rich biodiversity with 132 bird species, Unique horse-shaped Puwakhola river view
details.impact: Promotes bird watching tourism, Preserves biodiversity

destinations.name: Mahendra Ratna Multiple Campus
destinations.description: Mahendra Ratna Multiple Campus, Ilam, near Ilam bazar, is the oldest government campus established in 1959 AD. It is the first QAA certified constituent campus of Tribhuvan University, offering programs in Agriculture, Education, Humanities, and Management Faculties.

details.significance: First QAA certified constituent campus, Multiple faculty programs
details.impact: Provides higher education, Contributes to academic excellence

destinations.name: Ratna Kumar Bantawa Polytechnic Institute
destinations.description: Ratna Kumar Bantawa Polytechnic Institute (BPI), established in 2017 AD, is a publicly owned polytechnic Institute located in Sankhejung, Ilam Municipality-1. It offers a Diploma in Agriculture, Veterinary Science, Forestry, Pharmacy and different short-term vocational trainings.

details.significance: Provides technical education with scholarship facilities
details.impact: Provides affordable technical education, Develops skilled workforce

destinations.name: Ilam Durbar
destinations.description: Now known as the Araniko Cultural Museum, Ilam Durbar was built by Junga Bahadur Rana's son-in-law, Gajaraj Singh Thapa, in 1919 AD. The reestablished museum has a collection of materials reflecting indigenous cultural identity of different castes and communities over time and space.

details.significance: Historical building converted to cultural museum
details.impact: Preserves cultural heritage, Promotes historical education

destinations.name: Maibhagawati Briddhashram
destinations.description: Mai Bhagawati Briddhashram (Old Age Home) was established by Mahila Jagaran Sangh (MJS) in Ilam Municipality-10, Godak in 2006 AD. Covering 14 ropanis of land, this old care centre honors elderly people of Ilam and elsewhere, including abandoned, lonely, conflict-hit and at-risk through social protection.

details.significance: Elderly care center with temple and gardens
details.impact: Provides elderly care, Promotes social welfare

destinations.name: Mangmalung Mangsebung
destinations.description: On the top of the hill near the holy Gajurmukhi temple lies a beautiful natural forest called Mangmalung. In the forest land, scattered stones of different shapes and sizes create a natural stone museum. Southwards of Mangsebung lies a pilgrimage of Kirants called Mangsebung, home to Kirant Guru Atmananda.

details.attraction: Natural Stone Forest and Kirant Pilgrimage
details.significance: Natural stone formations, Kirant spiritual site
details.impact: Preserves Kirant culture, Promotes natural heritage

destinations.name: Gumba Danda
destinations.description: Gumba Danda (Shree Chechen Chyog Gyurling Gomba) is located at Ilam Municipality-6, Chureghanti. Established in 2049 BS (1992 AD) with the initiative of the locals of diverse sociocultural backgrounds, the Gomba covers 4 Ropanis of land with a Gomba building, a Lama quarter and a meeting hall.

details.significance: Buddhist cultural center established through community initiative
details.impact: Promotes Buddhist culture, Supports interfaith harmony
